result.execSummary:
The defendant David Ryan Krueger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David Ryan Krueger is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David Ryan Krueger was found guilty of Negligent Operation of Motor Vehicle, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

DNA Sample.
Absolute Sobriety.
AODA and complete follow through.
Ct. 2 - Dismissed.

timeConds.notes: Any vehilce operated on non-duty time.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Ryan Krueger

defendant.name: Krueger, David Ryan
defendant.address: N1600 County Road D, Antigo, WI 54409

records.addlTxt: DNA Proof of Submission
DNA Order and Acknowledgement

02:23 PM Defendant David Ryan Krueger in court with attorney Dennis Michael Melowski.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Melowski withdrawal motion.  State gives plea agreement amend to 941.01(1), withheld sentence 12 months probation, 12 months IID, Absolute sobriety, AODA, costs, Officer is issuing a citation for Failure to Yield, 175.30.  Citation being issued for Failure to Yield, 346.46(1), no contest plea, Finding Guilty and orders 175.30. Court grants state motion to amend Negligent of operation of motor vehicle, 941.01(1), Ct 2 Dismissed. Court goes over plea questionnaire and waiver of rights. Victim complied with rights. No restitution request. No contest to amendment.  Def. advised of constitutional rights & JT. Def. understands elements.  Class A misdemeanor. Atty Melowski is satisfied.  Court finds plea is freely & voluntarily given.  Factual basis.  State gives reason why amendment. Atty Melowski replys. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and finds def. Guilty to Ct 1 Negligent Operation of motor vehicle. State gives sentencing recommendation.  Atty Melowski gives sentencing recommendation. Def. has nothing to say. Court withdraws motions. Court orders on Ct 1
withheld sentence 12 months probation, 12 months IID on personal vehicle only outside of work, no CDL requirement doesn't apply for IID, Absolute Sobriety, AODA and complete follow though costs 200 DNA Surcharge and sample.  Bond applied and balance applied to citation and def. will pay off balance today If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def. advised of postconviction rights.  State gives reference was not amended because of CDL. Clerk questions IID & citation-  ADA wording (Any vehicle operated on non-duty time). No IID required for vehicle operation for employment purposes. Court like DA wording.  Officer wrote citation of 346.18(2), Court wants new citation issued for 346.1(2) with violation date of 1-27-16.

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on March 15, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Dennis Michael Melowski in court.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 11:17 am. Parties are waiting for Supreme Court decision, Parties agree to adjourn.  Atty Melowski can appear by phone.  Status conference scheduled for July 10, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Motion hearing on March 9, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Motion hearing on December 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
to Appear
No use of consume alcohol.  No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Defendant David Ryan Krueger in court with attorney Dennis Michael Melowski, by telephone.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 9:38 am.  Atty Melowski does not have copy of complaint, however, def. has copy of complaint, Court advised def. of charges & penalties. Atty Melowski waives reading of complaint & enters Not Guilty plea to both ct's.  Court receives Not Guilty plea to both ct's.  State gives bond recommendation. Court orders $550.00 cash bond, already posted with conditions. Atty Melowski can appear by phone for Status Cnf, def. does not have to appear for Status Cnf.  Status conference scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
